comment.author: 79334698@N00
comment._content: www.smithsonianmag.com/history-archaeology/pietown.html?c... Great article with the history of Pie Town inspired by these photographs.

comment.author: 21589081@N04
comment._content: She probably bought the blocks with the designs already stamped on them.  Such kits were popular, even through the 1960s.  I have a State Flowers quilt my grandmother made from a kit.

comment.author: 10733061@N05
comment._content:
Nice bed quilt. I like the way the green and red sashing meets in a chequered arrangement between each block.
Clearly not this lady's first quilt. Pity the sunlight is so bright that it obscures the detail of the bird blocks.
Wonder if her family still has it?'Tis very possible.

comment.author: 8229897@N03
comment._content: I love this shot.  My Aunt got patterns for a similar state bird embroidery in 1976.  She gave me the blocks and I made them into a quilt.

comment.author: 37985509@N08
comment._content: If you run it through Photoshop, the green and red very quickly turns into blue and red, so it was probably supposed to be a red-white-and-blue affair.
